content: attach bride and groom hands together their arms form the bottom point of the heart with scrap piece of yarn attach tips of bride and groom hats together which forms the heart humps to secure hat flap in place so it doesn t fold up take a scrap piece of yarn and weave it through the hat flap to secure it down hair i did not add hair to these gnomes because i was going for a minimalist approach however there are a few ways you can add hair option 1 for bride braid several strands of yarn together then attach one braid on both sides of the nose and under the flap of the hat option 1 for groom needlefelt some wool or brushed out acrylic yarn under and around the nose and hat option 2 for groom cut 6-inch strips of yarn and attach with hook under/around nose and hat see photos below from my gnome glasses holder pattern that demonstrates this technique designed by crochet by those_yellow_things your source for unique handmade items rings worked in joining rounds with silver/grey ring 1 chain 7 slip_stitch to first chain to form ring 12 single_crochet in ring slip_stitch to join fasten_off ring 2 chain 7 place start of tail through ring 1 slip_stitch to first chain to form ring now the rings should be interlocking 12 single_crochet in ring slip_stitch to join fasten_off using yarn attach at the peak of both hat tips that are touching reference photo enjoy your new wedding gnomes if you would like to support my designs you can buy me a coffee on venmo @thoseyellowthings designed by crochet by those_yellow_things your source for unique handmade items
